titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Randall Stewart Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

chronitem.event: His family moved to Nashville where he grew up and was educated.
Was graduated from Vanderbilt University as Founder’s Medalist.
Instructor of English at the University of Oklahoma.
Served briefly in the armed forces.
Married Cleone Odell in Oklahoma City.
Awarded master of arts degree by Harvard University.
Awarded doctor of philosophy degree by Yale.
Chairman, American Literature Group, Modern Language Association.
Professor of English and Chairman, Department of English, Vanderbilt University.
Mrs. Harold S. Vanderbilt Literary Symposium established.

did.unittitle: Correspondence-Outgoing. Letters are chronologically arranged. Nov. 23, 1955 to Oct. 1, 1959. Undated placed at end. See Index to Outgoing Correspondence.
Correspondence-Incoming. Chronologically arranged. March 2, 1932 - Dec. 4, 1967. Undated. See Index to Incoming Correspondence.
Calendars of Events and Guest List, Fugitive Reunion.
Fugitive Finances. Vouchers, financial statements regarding the handling of finances for the Fugitive Reunion.
Fugitive Conference Dinner Programs enclosed in Harvie Branscomb letter,
Fugitive Reunion Photos Taken by Merrill Moore.
Book Reviews - Pertaining to R. C. Beatty’s column.
One photograph of Donald Davidson effigy.

The following describes Randall Stewart’s papers as they were arranged by topic in Dr. Stewart’s files. Letters, both incoming and outgoing, were stapled together by subject. Arrangement was roughly chronological.
List of Topics In Stewart Collection
Arrangements of Fugitive Reunion, Correspondence. Covers period from
Fugitive Reunion Arrangements - Miscellaneous. Consisting of calendar of events, newspaper clippings, list of guests, holograph notes of Merrill Moore’s suggestions, Vanderbilt Calendar.
Fugitive Finances - Consisting of vouchers, financial statements, and letters regarding the handling of finances for the Fugitive Reunion. Letters from
Fugitive Conference: Results - Correspondence dealing with conference.
Publishing Fugitive Conference (and matters related to Fugitives, Pictures, and Books) Correspondence.
Fugitive Reunion Photographs - Taken by Merrill Moore.
Stewart Correspondence Relating to Non-Fugitive Matters.
Syndication of Beatty’s literary column in the Nashville Tennessean. Correspondence
Supplementary Description - page 2 Book reviews written by Beatty.
Allen Tate Proposal - Correspondence concerns proposal to Fugitive Memorial Professorship.
ALPHABETICAL LIST OF INCOMING CORRESPONDENTS RANDALL STEWART COLLECTION
Partial names are listed at the end. Folder indicated by F.
